intro: Salpichroa wrightii, commonly known as Wright's sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Salpichroa wrightii is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
